page.title: 13A SENSE OF BELONGING
page.content: The area is predominately Middle Class with a commensurate life-style. The vast majority of housing is privately owned. Most people leave the area for their work, but take pride in their home surroundings and enjoy a sense of community. This is particularly true in Rottingdean and Ovingdean which have an older population and less geographical mobility. The pace of life is slow. In Saltdean there is less sense of a village community as much of the housing is of recent years. Every day family needs are provided by ample shops but residents tend to drive to Brighton for their main week-end shopping.
